##Confessions of a family member of a critically ill patient

WMSYGSDR

Function introduction, each line has the earnest person, again the ordinary person also has the extraordinary story. Huazhong University of Science and Technology Press Official non-fiction story platform, the story of the people will meet here.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
“

- In the event of an outbreak -

Seeing my dad's strong heart and optimistic state of mind filled me with confidence, too.

”

“

- In the event of an outbreak -

Seeing my dad's strong heart and optimistic state of mind filled me with confidence, too.

- In the event of an outbreak -

Seeing my dad's strong heart and optimistic state of mind filled me with confidence, too.

”

Story exercise

58

On the evening of January 20, academician Zhong Nanshan's affirmation of "new type of pneumonia transmitted from person to person" sent the whole country into a state of infinite panic about the infection of the virus. For a while, all the pharmacies of masks, alcohol almost sold out, Wuhan "closed city" , the country closed, everyone self-fear.

The outbreak coincides with the eve of the Spring Festival. Although the sky is full of epidemic reports, but this still does not wash away my joy to go home for the New Year. On the evening of the New Year's Eve, after dinner, I sat on the floor of my apartment, humming a tune as I packed my bags, and mused that I would go home and eat a lot.

However, all this peace and good little happiness, after I received a phone call from my mother, fragmented.

From January 20,2020 until today

Location: Shanghai

1

"Y! Your Dad's in the hospital! "

I got a call from my mother on the afternoon of the 21st. That day the sun is good, standing in front of the office windows, the temperature of more than ten degrees Celsius, people basked in all over the body lazy.
But at this time, I heard the bad news can not help but feel cold all over.

"What's the matter? Isn't it a little cold? " I am a little anxious.

"Your father went to Wuhan in early January. The hospital suspected it might be... "

The news came too suddenly, my thought still stays in last night: not to say that the small cold does not matter? Vaguely remember, my mother clearly last night also laughed at my father disrelish infusion room environment is not good, insisted that she put dinner to the car to eat.

Wait! They had dinner together in the car?

"How are you, mother? Is something wrong? "

"I'm quarantined too. It's right across from Your Dad's room. " Mom, not surprisingly, went in.

At that time, Wuhan Pneumonia "human to human" News just two days, although the face mask prices, Wuhan News flying, but I Surprise, the epidemic has been so close to us.

That afternoon, the hospital came the news, dad's nucleic acid test was positive, the city became the first confirmed case.

I had planned to return early on New Year's Eve, but my father insisted that I do not go back: "You come back to do? I and your mother are in the hospital, no family, you might as well stay there to save US trouble. "

My father's hard-line attitude could not be rejected, and he considered it again and again. In order to comfort the elderly in my family, and also to avoid the peak of the Spring Festival travel rush and protect my own safety, I returned the high-speed train ticket I had finally managed to get at a fixed point. I lied to my grandparents and told them that things were serious outside, the high-speed Railway Danger Coefficient is too big, this time does not gather together to eat the New Year's Eve meal, waited for the epidemic to pass again to eat together.

I don't know, but this year, I'm doomed.

Since that day, I have been video calling my mother every day, and I have also written a long letter to my father, thanking him for his hard work and strong faith, which have influenced me for so many years, to Be as good, as smart, as hard-working as he was.

To keep myself emotionally stable, I talk to my friend CC every day. Although life went on as planned, I knew that the pressure and suffering inside me was overwhelming me.

New Year's Eve is coming, and though the epidemic is still spreading, the year is still coming and meals are to be eaten. I thought this was the worst thing that could happen, but I didn't want it to be the beginning of a nightmare.

2

"Little Y, the hospital has sent a transfer notice. Your father seems to be in bad condition. "

Just as the National Health Commission announced that the epidemic was far less deadly than SARS in 2003, we received a notification from the hospital: My father has become seriously ill, it must be sent to XX hospital as soon as possible, to be treated as a cluster of the best specialists in the province.

But it also means that mom and dad are splitting up.

These days, even if the couple in distress are isolated, but because they know each other in the side, less than 10 meters away from their own opposite place, the heart is finally have sustenance. The two of them had to rely on each other to make it this far.

"My mom is having a bit of a meltdown right now, and my dad doesn't want to go to the hospital. " I was upset and called the hospital to try to help my parents as much as possible.

Sure enough, the hospital took a hard line on the separation, even though both partners had refused.

The doctor sent me a picture of the transfer notice.

I finally understood why my mother was so afraid -- because the notice said, "severe illness, respiratory failure, please inform the family. ". These words are so bright and painful that no one knows what it's like to be transferred to a hospital -- is it okay to turn around on your own? Can anyone take care of him? So many patients treated together, can cross-infection?

In spite of our fears, we know that if we don't turn, we may be waiting to die.

There was no better way. Dad was eventually transferred.

Mother continued to stay in the hospital isolation observation, but gradually there are signs of cough, fever. To relieve symptoms and boost her immune system, doctors began giving her drugs, hoping to control the disease.

It's always harder when you're alone.

That's it. It's New Year's Eve.

3

This Spring Festival has been simple, rare tacit understanding of the people across the country, the night sky is clean, there is no fireworks.

On New Year's Eve, I went to a friend's house and made dumplings together. The dumplings with three fresh fillings were very lovely. When the dumplings were put into the pot, I happily passed some photos to CC to show my first excellent dumpling making skills.

UPS and downs, finally also had a hot New Year dinner.

Friends have also gradually know my family, see I can finally pick up the spirit of hard life, a little heartache, but also relieved some.

On the morning of the fifth day of the Lunar New Year, the hospital sent a good news: the mother nucleic acid test is negative, can be discharged!
After talking to my mom on the phone, I couldn't wait to share the news with CC: "I'm so happy! I feel like my persistence has finally paid off! "

That morning, we talked for a long time about our travel plans after the epidemic, about where the sea was bluer and the buildings were more attractive, and about giving our parents a hug when we got home, they even shared their tips on how to grab the fruits and vegetables faster and more efficiently these days.

My Body and mind did not relax for a long time, to hear their long-lost high-pitched voice, I feel alive again.

"My mother is coming home today, but she still needs to be isolated at home for 14 days and can not go out. They were admitted to the hospital years ago, and now there is nothing at home and no supplies at all. "

Considering the reality of livelihood issues, we temporarily interrupted the free-flowing chat, contact the aunt living near home. After some communication, aunt volunteered, during the isolation of her mother's food by her responsibility.

Hung up the phone, I opened the window of the room, a few rays of light from the gap in the clouds, it has been raining for several days finally stopped.

Things are looking up.

4

Pitter-patter of rain, stopped a day and began to fall. It's a little gloomy out there.
Late the first night of February, I got a call from the hospital.

"Hello, is this XX? I'm from XX hospital. I'm your father's doctor. We regret to inform you that the patient is not in a good condition. We discussed the need to consider a different treatment, may need to increase the amount of drugs, does not rule out the possibility of inhalation machine, after cure may still have some sequelae. We need the family to sign off on the change of treatment."

I haven't spoken to him all day. The doctor's voice is tired.

"Ok, I'll think about it and call you back. " I held my phone tightly and heard myself reply, polite and calm.

I'm actually kind of scared. I do not know back, waiting for me is what kind of reality, or directly is the end?

But the reality of the situation does not allow me to hesitate, and despite the family's objections, as a daughter, I sincerely hope that I do not make decisions that I may later regret.

Work can ask for leave, now is not the Spring Festival rush, carefully do protective work, I firmly believe that the two-hour flight is still feasible.

Maybe going back was a long-struggling idea, and when I figured it out, I immediately turned on my phone to check the nearest flight.

"call the hospital first, then go back and try to see the attending doctor. Even though we don't know anything about medicine, we still need to understand the situation. Besides, your mother is in isolation at home. Let's prepare the power of attorney together. "

I told CC what was going on, and she wanted to think as much as possible about the situation, to be prepared, so she wouldn't be too upset when she got back.

"after going back to see the doctor first, have a few more masks ready and replace them in time. Be sure to protect yourself. "

"We'll be waiting for you. Come on. "

"Come on. "

The next day, I got on a plane home. Looking out the window of the sky, I think, even if the difficulties, with the family side, do all the backing, firm belief, is my greatest strength.

5

Two hours later, I got off the plane.

I saw these days have been hard to send food and fruit aunt, simple to understand the situation, aunt sent me to the father's hospital. The hospital's prevention and control measures are very strict, private cars can only drive to the gate, a car, a group of medical staff against us and the car spray alcohol.

Aunt is not immediate family, can not be admitted to the hospital. I walked into the doctor's office alone, and after nearly an hour of talking, I signed a transcript of the patient's family's conversation and agreed to a change of treatment.

But I didn't see my dad in the hospital room, or my mom in isolation at home.

After all that, I checked into a hotel two blocks from my house. After the outbreak, it was worse in my hometown than in the city where I work. The hotel did not open, only a few clean rooms, and the manager to communicate the situation, the hotel promised to give me accommodation, but there is no cleaning services, all on their own.

"It's all right. The more people you meet now, the more danger you're in. " CC thought it would be a good thing and everyone would be safe.

"Yes, I've just come into my room now, and I've just gone to the supermarket to buy some fruit to eat. " I went on: "I spoke to the doctor and it's true that dad is not doing well and there are complications. We're mixing it up with other hospitals now and, if possible, we may start to use anti-fibrotic drugs. "

I just sent a signed transcript confirmation to CC.
Although the situation is indeed not as optimistic as I thought, but I came back here, my heart finally relieved, a lot easier.

Before the incident, my father and I barely spoke, and we barely communicated. After coming back, my father and I send wechat every day, encourage him to be strong, although he often only replied to me a word or two, but my heart is much more stable.

Although he was in great physical pain, as soon as he was well enough to sit up in bed, he began to work. "It's not about the individual, it's about some social responsibility, " he said

I understand that this outbreak on the catering tourism industry relatively large impact. He intends to the company in the handling fee, channel fees and deduction points on the first half of the merchant free, the wages of employees must be guaranteed. "while this adds to the pressure on the company, we must not push people out into the community at a time of greater instability. "

My Dad started his own business when I was in school, and he was very busy at work. After this business trip in Wuhan, there was no time to make any decision, on the temporary isolation was taken to the hospital. After the outbreak of panic, I did not think that even if dad in the ICU, but also concerned about the staff and society, perhaps this is the social responsibility of Chinese entrepreneurs. From my dad, I learned more than just hard work, patience, and a sense of purpose.

"Dad was happy. He was doing what he wanted to do. All this time, we've been telling him to get more rest, what he wants to eat, and we've been ignoring his inner needs. After what Dad said, it suddenly dawned on me that it's not just physical, we need to focus on how he's feeling inside."seeing dad in such a strong and optimistic state of mind, i'm feeling confident, too.

Keep great patience and responsibility, February 8, the hospital came word, dad finally got better, do not need to wear a 24-hour suction machine.

Doctors say that means his lung function is gradually returning.

I was so happy that I had an extra bowl for dinner that night.

So far, DAD's nucleic acid test is still positive, lymphocyte and other physiological indexes are not up to standard, is still ICU patients. But the overall picture is much better than it was years ago.

Looking back on this period of tortuous experience, I think of my parents sent me to study abroad from a young age, when things rarely help me solve, they have things will not tell me. Dad, in particular, was always under the impression of working hard in his career, providing me with a good material foundation, and everything else on his own.

I think, after this outbreak, maybe we're still not talking. But through this growth, I have a better understanding of the hearts of parents, and the quality of their selfless dedication. This dedication, not only to me, this is the company, the community's insistence.

We know that the emotional granularity of Chinese dads is very coarse, they do not communicate, do not speak, do not explain. But behind the scenes, they often do their best to provide us with the safest and best possible world.

Because that's how they show their love.

(this article was dictated by a friend.)

-END-

- I'm a storyteller. -

Author | CC, young author.

A still from the flu
